lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.User.title: User
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.User.description: Basic user. TODO: Merge with other notions of a user.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Organiza.title: Organization
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Organiza.description:
Organization - collection of Users with shared assets. We do not prescribe
 here any semantics about whether a user can be in more than one organization,
 or any other relationships.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Role.title: Role
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Role.description:
A role for a principal (likely a user) within an organization. Mostly used
 for Authorization. Anticipating the need for more roles here, we space out
 the values to leave unused numbers so that we can add more later while
 preserving the natural ordering of permissions. We don't prescribe specific
 authorizations here despite the suggestive names.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Organiza.title: OrganizationRole
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Organiza.description:
A role specified in the context of a particular organization. Can be used as
 its own Principal as a convenient way to define groups of permissions.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Principa.title: Principal
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Principa.description:
A Principal is an entity in an authorization context, such as a user
 requesting read access to a resource or an organization who owns it.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Subject.title: Subject

isWildcard.description:
When true, this flag dictates that the Subject represents the entire
 resource type. The `id` field must also be a literal "*" or else we should
 fail validation, to avoid magic strings or unexpected auth configurations.
 A wildcard subject is especially important for creating new resources of a
 type (CREATE), and listing (LIST), since in each case there is no existing
 ID to base authorization on.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Subject.description: A Subject is an entity to which access can be granted, such as a dataset.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Predicat.title: Predicate
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Predicat.description:
A Predicate is either a statement or a query of authorization - when a
 Principal, Subject, and Scope are specified, it has a positive or negative
 answer. For example, "can user 4 access resource 9 to write?" or something
 like "user_4:resource_9:write". When the Principal is omitted, it is a
 Clause, and can be used to specify an authorization constraint on a resource.
 For example, simply "resource_9:write", tagging a concrete action with its
 authorization requirements. When the Subject is itself a Principal, the
 Predicate expresses a relation between the Principals. For example, an owner
 user 11 might have write access to a basic user 3, or write access to a whole
 org. Importantly, the target (subject, scope) must have authorization not
 greater than the principal, since the predicate enables "impersonation". So,
 an organization should typically not be authorized to act as an individual
 user this way, since it would confer the same authorization to every member.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Clause.title: Clause
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Clause.description:
A Clause is a Predicate not bound to a Principal, specifying a requirement
 for authorization. Example: "dataset_5:write" might represent the "write"
 scope on a resource "dataset_5"

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.ChatMess.title: ChatMessage
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.ChatMess.description: Represents a message from the user or the assistant.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.ChatComp.title: ChatCompletionRequest

model.description: The ID of the model to use for the completion.

messages.description: The list of messages in the conversation so far.

maxTokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

temperature.description: The temperature to use for the completion.

topP.description: The top_p value to use for the completion.

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.ChatComp.description: The list of messages in the conversation so far.

storageUri.description: For example, S3 URI for bucket, or file URI

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.ModelAss.title: ModelAsset
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.ModelAss.description: Actual file asset(s) corresponding to a model. Can be a directory of assets

lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Job.title: Job
lmai.proto.model_fine_tuning.v1.Job.description:
Common properties for Jobs (typically tasks handled by a worker, async with
 respect to any API)

lmai.proto.webserver.v2.CreateDatasetFil.title: CreateDatasetFileRequest
lmai.proto.webserver.v2.CreateDatasetFil.description: TODO: Upload via more traditional HTTP route
